image.altText: A teenage boy in a white hoodie and black baseball cap

props.synopsis: Three people convicted of murdering 18-year-old Kingsley Alley Jr after a dispute over a spilled drink have launched an appeal to have their guilty verdicts thrown out.

title.children: Trio jailed for NT teenager's murder claim 'miscarriage of justice'

image.altText: A dead ant lies on a reed in the bush.

props.synopsis: Some of the country's top scientists have been working with Indigenous rangers to access rugged parts of the Arnhem Land plateau that are rarely seen, even by traditional owners.¬†

title.children: Zombie ants among striking finds as scientists explore Arnhem Land

image.altText: A woman dressed as a clown puts her arm around a woman in nurse's scrubs during an event on a sunny day in a park.

props.synopsis: Alice Springs residents have celebrated the warmth, openness and diversity of their community at the annual Bangtail Muster event.

title.children: 'Magic of friendship' on show at Bangtail Muster in Alice Springs

image.altText: Glen Oliver discovered a new variety of date palm ten years ago.

props.synopsis: Mitakoodi man Glen Oliver has nurtured a huge variety of plant species over the years, but the highlight of his career in horticulture has been discovering a new date palm.

title.children: Date variety discovered by outback horticulturalist now grown globally

image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price speaking onstage, with Peter Dutton standing behind her.

props.synopsis: It wasn't a Donald Trump-inspired cap that swayed votes in the Northern Territory on election night. The issues faced on the ground are far bigger.

title.children: It wasn't Nampijinpa Price's MAGA hat that lost the NT for the Coalition

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Ms Patterson is accused of murdering three relatives by serving them a beef Wellington laced with poisonous death cap mushrooms. Follow the trial in our live blog.

title.children: Dying lunch guest's 'extremely abnormal' blood test results raised hospital alarm, court hears

image.altText: Perin Davey listens to a press conference by Water Minister Tanya Plibersek at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Nationals deputy leader Perin Davey is on track to lose her Senate seat to Labor, telling ABC News Radio she is "shattered" and that a fall in the Liberal vote has cost her. Follow live.

title.children: Nationals deputy leader 'shattered' she will likely lose Senate seat

image.altText: A man sitting on a stage wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Leading economist Professor Ross Garnaut says Labor could seize on its thumping election win to revisit significant reforms such as the carbon price and mining tax.

title.children: Could Labor's thumping election win put tax reform back on the agenda?

image.altText: A composite photo of a brunette woman, brown haired man with glasses, blonde woman with glasses and dark haired man.

props.synopsis: The tense wait continues in a number of Victorian seats, including Melbourne and Goldstein, where counting is yet to see a clear path towards a winner.

title.children: Greens' Adam Bandt in danger as seat of Melbourne remains on knife's edge

image.altText: Electricians place solar panels on roof

props.synopsis: Australian voters have overwhelmingly chosen household batteries over nuclear, rejecting the Coalition's anti-renewables agenda.

title.children: Solar uptake a clue to why Australians chose batteries over nuclear

image.altText: rihanna met

props.synopsis: Follow along in our live blog as some of the biggest stars grace the Met Gala steps for fashion's night of nights.

title.children: Rihanna, Janelle Mon√°e, Diana Ross and dramatic suit reveals at this year's Met Gala

image.altText: A man and a woman walking along the street.

props.synopsis: The NSW Crime Commission will reconsider pursuing Labor minister Eddie Obeid over $30 million he made from a corrupt coal deal after premier promises additional resources.

title.children: Crime commission to look at new ways of retrieving Obeid's 'ill gotten gains'

image.altText: Two small boys, with faces blurred, in a karate class.

props.synopsis: The Coonabarabran community in north-west NSW is in shock today after two young boys were found dead inside a home. A 66-year-old woman was arrested at the scene.

title.children: Grandmother likely to face 'serious charges' after deaths of two young boys

image.altText: A man wearing an American Badass t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Most Greenlanders oppose the US president's threats to invade, but some believe it could give them leverage in their fight for independence from Denmark.

title.children: Greenland's problem? 'Not enough MAGA hats' to go around

image.altText: Two beef cattle in a field

props.synopsis: Farmers fought against the first-term Albanese government. Can the relationship be repaired the second time around?

title.children: Farmers urged to 'hold firm' on policies upon Labor's return

image.altText: A big fan, a helicopter, and a crane with lots of people standing around on a film set.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump is eyeing Hollywood for his next round of tariffs, threatening to target all films produced outside the US at a rate of 100 per cent.

title.children: Trump has threatened a tariff on movies made outside the US. Here's what we know

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns as he looks off camera while Xi Jinping stands behind him.

props.synopsis: America has decided to sever its trading relationship with China ‚Äî a strategy that ultimately will come at enormous cost. And Australia, more than any other nation, will be caught smack in the middle.

title.children: The world is becoming a dangerous place. Australia is caught in the middle

image.altText: Bejnamin Netanyahu wearing a navy jacket, white shirt and a gold and Israeli flag lapel pin while grimacing

props.synopsis: Israel has approved plans to seize the Gaza Strip and stay in the Palestinian territory for an unspecified amount of time, Israeli officials say.

title.children: Palestinians would be moved to Gaza's south under 'intensive' Israeli plan

image.altText: Raw vanadium rock

props.synopsis: Australian mining companies could benefit from US-China trade war, but they are walking a tightrope between their biggest export market in China and Australia's greatest ally in the US.

title.children: Australian miners see opportunities during US and China trade war chaos

image.altText: Traffic jam on M1 north of Sydney after hundreds of cars get flat tyres

props.synopsis: The transport company at the centre of a scrap metal spill on the M1 motorway is counting the cost with more than 1,000 claims so far for tyre damage.

title.children: M1 scrap metal spill damage bill rises as drivers claim tyre repairs

image.altText: Photo collage Peter Dutton, Michael Sukkar, David Coleman and Bridget Archer

props.synopsis: And it's dealt a serious blow to their pipeline of future leadership talent.

title.children: The Liberals' suburban wipe-out has complicated leadership discussions

image.altText: Electric vehicle plugged into a charger on a tree-lined city street.

props.synopsis: As new electric vehicle sales rise, more EVs are entering the used-car market. Are used-EV batteries any good, and how can you check?

title.children: How long can you expect a battery to last in a second-hand EV?

image.altText: Woman in green shirt smiles leaning on man in white shirt who also smiles. A piano is in the background.

props.synopsis: Richard Tognetti is exacting, virtuosic and at the helm of one of the world's best chamber orchestras. He sits down with Virginia Trioli to talk work ethic, what brings him joy and what irks him.

title.children: Why the head of one of the world's best orchestras still worries about scales

image.altText: A chart tracks stock market lower

props.synopsis: Local shares have opened fairly flat this morning after US stocks fell overnight. Australia's Future Fund has posted investment returns of 7.9 per cent in the past year. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX slightly down and value of Australia's Future Fund up

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Economist urges Labor to follow in footsteps of Curtin and Hawke with ambitious reform

image.altText: A woman's arms are pictured - one typing on a laptop while the other holds a credit card.

props.synopsis: Using a credit card linked to your offset account can save on your mortgage but you need to be aware of the pitfalls to decide whether it will work for you. ¬†¬†

title.children: A mortgage offset account and credit card can save you but there are pitfalls

image.altText: Palmer scratches his head.

props.synopsis: Despite spending $60 million on campaign advertisements, Clive Palmer's Trumpet of Patriots party has failed to win a single seat in the lower house.

title.children: After millions of dollars and texts, Trumpet of Patriots fails to deliver

image.altText: GettyImages-1736580251 (1)

props.synopsis: The AFLW is returning to its roots by scheduling a Cartlon-Collingwood season opener, prompting mixed reactions from fans and experts in the women's game.

title.children: AFLW commentator says season opener honours history but calls for bigger stadium

image.altText: A woman in a light-coloured blazer.

props.synopsis:
Newly-elected SA MP Claire Clutterham says her varied career ‚Äî including an international role as a lawyer ‚Äî has prepared her for her new role as the first woman to represent the seat of Sturt in Adelaide's eastern suburbs.

title.children: Newly elected MP who defied her own party's polling

image.altText: An anonymous cardinal wearing bright red robes with gold accents looks up.

props.synopsis: In its 800-year history, a conclave has never been this diverse. How will this changing face of Catholicism impact the result of the papal vote?

title.children: 'He's one of us': Catholics around the world are watching the conclave

image.altText: An old lady sits, leaning on a wall as she holds an empty metal pot.

props.synopsis: As people queue for hours for a bowl of soup, Israel maintains its blockade of food and aid ‚Äî and the groups keeping people fed warn their supplies are running out.

title.children: Outside Gaza sits 116,000 tonnes of food as people inside run out

image.altText: Mike Bush speaking at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Victoria's new police commissioner Mike Bush says he will focus on crime prevention and lifting officer morale.¬†

title.children: New top cop Mike Bush to make significant changes to Victoria Police

image.altText: Whales stranded on a beach.

props.synopsis: Four whales have died and wildlife workers are attempting to rescue the remaining three that are beached in the state's south.

title.children: Authorities work to save whales stranded on remote WA beach

image.altText: Josh Giddey with Benny's Boys players after a social game in Franskton.

props.synopsis: A social basketball team in Frankston did a double take when they saw Chicago Bulls star Josh Giddey suiting up for the opposition on Monday night.

title.children: 'This game's not going to go our way': NBA star crashes social game in Melbourne
